title: New Administrative Capital
summary: The New Administrative Capital (NAC)[1][2] (Arabic: العاصمة الإدارية الجديدة‎, romanized: Al-ʿĀṣima al-ʾIdāriyya al-Jadīda) is a large-scale project of a new capital city in Egypt that has been under construction since 2015.[3] It was announced by the then Egyptian housing minister Mostafa Madbouly at the Egypt Economic Development Conference on 13 March 2015.[4] The capital city is considered one of the programs and projects for economic development, and is part of a larger initiative called Egypt Vision 2030.[5]
